    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Quelaunt</h1>This three-armed, three-legged monster has no discernible eyes, nose, ears, or mouth or no visible means of ingesting food. Its limbs are distributed so evenly across its body that it is all but impossible to tell which way the creature is oriented at any given time. Few who witness the quelaunt linger on its alien looks for long though, as the most pressing concern quickly becomes the invasion of their minds, as the quelaunt sows doubt, sorrow, and rage. This monstrosity not only delights in the negative emotions of its prey, but feeds on them, gaining strength and sustenance from their dismay. For the quelaunt, no act is too terrible or cruel to inflict on its victims, since the more a creature suffers, the more the quelaunt feasts.<br /><br /> Quelaunts are known to associate with other aberrant horrors, including brain collectors and other creatures associated with the Dominion of the Black. However, the more prevalent theory paints them as more alien—perhaps invasive beings from another dimension of pure thought and feeling—and claims that in their natural state they have no physical bodies at all. Few dare speculate further; the only known autopsy of a quelaunt resulted in the researcher’s suicide just days afterward and all the notes were mysteriously destroyed. Whatever secrets there are to be unlocked in the anatomy of these bizarre monsters are apparently important enough to warrant great protection from quelaunts, even after death.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Aberration</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=11">Occultism</a></u>)</b>: DC 34<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=343">Quelaunt</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 15</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Quelaunt.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Quelaunt.png"></a><span alt="Chaotic Evil" class="traitalignment" title="Chaotic Evil">CE</span><span alt="Large" class="traitsize" title="Large">Large</span><span alt="Aberration Trait" class="trait" title="Aberrations are creatures from beyond the planes or corruptions of the natural order."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=1">Aberration</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 273</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +29; tremorsense (imprecise) 60 feet<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=13"><u>Aklo</a></u>; (can't speak any language); telepathy 100 feet<br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5"><u>Deception</a></u> +30, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=7"><u>Intimidation</a></u> +30, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=11"><u>Occultism</a></u> +27<br /><b>Str</b> +6, <b>Dex</b> +5, <b>Con</b> +4, <b>Int</b> +5, <b>Wis</b> +6, <b>Cha</b> +8<hr /><b>AC</b> 36, <b>Fort</b> +27, <b>Ref</b> +26, <b>Will</b> +31 (+33 vs. emotion)<br /><b>HP</b> 305; <b>Resistances</b> mental 15<hr /><b>Speed</b> 40 feet; <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=6"><i>air walk</i></a><br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> claw +30 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 10 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 3d8+12 slashing</span><b>Occult Innate Spells</b> DC 39; <b>7th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=57">crushing despair</a></u></i> (x3); <b>3rd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=110">fear</a></u></i> (at will); <b>2nd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=150">hideous laughter</a></u></i>; <b>Constant</b> <b>(4th)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=6">air walk</a></u></i><br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Emotional Focus</b> The quelaunt can cast the following cleric domain spells as 8th-level occult innate spells at will without spending Focus Points: <i><a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=404">blind ambition</a></i>, <i><a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=405">captivating adoration</a></i>, and <i><a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=414">delusional pride</i></a>.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Emotional Frenzy</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Three Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\ThreeActions.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Three Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\ThreeActions_I.png">  The quelaunt casts up to three spells chosen from its at-will innate spells and its emotional focus spells.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Feed on Emotion</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=15"><u>attack</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=60"><u>emotion</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=93"><u>incapacitation</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=106"><u>mental</a></u>) <b>Frequency</b> once per round; <b>Effect</b> The quelaunt feeds on the emotional unrest of a single creature within 30 feet that’s under a harmful emotion effect. The target must succeed at a DC 37 Will save or take 4d10 mental damage and be stunned for 1 round. If the target fails its saving throw, the quelaunt regains the same number of Hit Points and Feed on Emotion does not cost the quelaunt an action, allowing it to use another action this turn.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Rapid Strikes</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=15"><u>attack</a></u>) The quelaunt makes three melee Strikes, each against a different target within reach. The multiple attack penalty applies to each attack, but increases only after all the attacks have been made.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Spiral of Despair</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Free Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\FreeAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Free Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\FreeAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=60"><u>emotion</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=106"><u>mental</a></u>) <b>Trigger</b> A creature fails a saving throw to resist one of the quelaunt’s innate spells or emotional focus spells. <b>Effect</b> As the quelaunt invades the triggering creature’s mind and plants the seeds of negative emotions, it also strips away the target’s feelings of hope or positivity. The quelaunt can immediately end a single <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=60">emotion</a> effect from which the triggering creature is benefiting. </span><h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> Other Quelaunts</h3>Perhaps the most frightening tales
of quelaunts attribute them with
abilities beyond those detailed
here, suggesting that quelaunts
might be an entire category
of alien menace that has only
recently turned its awful attention
to humanity.</span>

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));

      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
</body>
</html>
